availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry G. Graddy (Hopkins County, KY, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Hester Graddy. Father of Sarah Graddy, Halstead Graddy, Roland Graddy, Mary E. Graddy, Henry Graddy, Rachel Graddy, Helen Graddy, and James K. P. Graddy. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 99A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 700.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 780.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 217B.
"Henry Greek Grady (1804-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial #25793792, accessed October 27, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25793792.
